RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout

RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The base class of all the layout.

Un layout contains a widget list AND another list wich can be use like it want. it is a numeric values list. This second list can not be defined here. It must be defined in the Layout's subclass.

In order to draw properly the widgets, we must know the window position. xOrigin and yOrigin are set with the setOrigin( int, int ) method and are passed as paramater of the Widget::draw( int, int ).

The addWidget(Widget*, ...) function can have some parameter, according to the layout type.

Add the widget and set its x and y properties.

It simply calls the Layout::addWidget(Widget*), the Widget::setX(int) and the Widget::setY(int) functions.

Definition at line 220 of file layout.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout::getFirstFocus (  ) 

Set the first focus of the first Widget that can have it.

It tuns through the widgetList and set the first Widget that can be focused (according to the Widget::canTakeFocus property).

Definition at line 135 of file layout.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout::getNextFocus (  ) 

The the next widget to have the focus.

It iterates through the widgetList and set the focus to the next focusable widget.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout::currentWidgetLostFocus (  )  [private]

Set the current focused widget to has not the focus.

Member Data Documentation

Widget* RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout::focusedWidget [private]

The currently focused Widget.

This pointer stores the Widget currently focused to be able to turn off its focus status.

Definition at line 89 of file layout.h.

int RainbruRPG::Terminal::Layout::focusedWidgetIndex [private]

The focused widget index in the widgetList.

This value is used to know where to start the iteration of the widgetList.
